availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Buel Williams and Sarah Williams. Married to Sarah "Salley" Alling Williams in Montgomery County, Tennessee, on March 11, 1851. Father of James Williams, Rufus Williams, and Sarah Williams. Resident in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Webster County, Kentucky, in 1860. Farmer in Webster County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 141B-142A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, Slaughtersville, p. 480.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, Sebree, p. 20D.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Webster County, KY, June 1863, p. 55.

Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Montgomery County Marriages, 1838-1874, p. 146.
